title: Ticket #1998: Perform RHEL 6 full port of Condor
description:
Perform a full port of Condor to the x86 and x86_64 platform for RHEL 6.

Milestones:

  1. DONE Does RHEL 5 port work out of the box? Answer: YES I informed NMI to install it on the rhel6 machine for now.
  2. DONE Clipped port of Condor code to RHEL 6, skipping externals that do not build.
  3. DONE Run cross-test of binaries built on RHEL 5 on RHEL 6. ~2 days
  4. SKIP Make certain a condor_compile occurs on the RHEL 6 machine. ~? days. #2071 [rat hole--skipping]
  5. [DONE] Get all externals building (5-ish days)
    • [DONE] Get coredumper building. 1 day
    • [DONE] Get blahp building. 1 day
    • [DONE] Get cream building. 1 day (thanks Jamie!)
    • [DONE] Get krb5 building. 1 day
  6. [DONE] Testing of clipped port, fixing discovered problems. ~2 days.
  7. [ON HOLD-no x86 rhel 6 machine in the BatLab] Port/test to x86. 2 days.
  8. [DONE] Porting standard universe. 2 months.

Record of porting:

  • Goal Try and get clipped port to compile

2011-May-25 13:41:24 by psilord:
The blahp seems to build on its own, so we pass that and move on.

2011-May-26 14:40:24 by psilord:
Ok, while making krb5 compile, I ran into two issues:

  1. EAI_NODATA isn't defined when compiling krb5. It turns out that this is because =getaddrinfo()='s description in distro's header files changed from RFC 2553 to RFC 3943 and didn't provide any backwards compatibility. I'm using code found here as a workaround. It shouldn't disturn platforms which correctly define EAI_NODATA, and hopfully work on platforms where it isn't defined.
  2. It turns out that source files in <krb5>/src/appl/gssftp/ftpd define and use their own getline() function. It turns out glibc has a definition now uses that name and it has a different prototype. So, I changed the function name and the calling of it in that directory.

Fixing these generated two patch files for this external.

2011-May-26 14:54:01 by psilord:
Jamie hacked upon cream to get it to build and supplied me with a patch, Now I'm just getting it all together and checking it in.

2011-May-26 16:27:14 by psilord:
I organized and committed the patches for the building of krb5 and jamie's cream patch. They've been committed to V7_6-branch and merged to master.

2011-May-27 16:36:11 by psilord:
I've added the clipped port of RHEL 6 x86_64 to the official port list of the V7_6-branch and master.

2011-May-31 16:12:51 by psilord:
I cannot perform the x86 port since there is no x86 rhel 6 machine in batlab. I sent a request to nmi-support to get one. It is [nmi-support #9336].

2011-Jun-14 16:37:02 by psilord:
Ok, after some hackery with getting some required packages installed on nmi-v031 which the x86_64 rhel 6 machine, I have gotten rpmbuild -bp to produce a patched version of glibc and rpmbuild -bc to build it. Now I have to extract the configure line and whatnot out of the output of those commands and ensure I can build the glibc package by hand.

2011-Jul-12 14:41:22 by psilord:
Current status update for the rhel6 x86_64 port:

  1. I finished downloading, building, and patching glibc. I left the --enable-static-nss patch is, but left the turn of nscd patch out (until I can figure out if I need it or not). Glibc now builds as an external.
  2. Sprinkled GLIBC212 around in the sources until condor compiled with 'make install'.
  3. Hacked our ld program until 'make tests' worked. I found some likely distro bugs in that 'gcc -static foo.c -lm' doesn't compile and the same problem exists with -lcrypt. At this point the test suite now builds too.

I haven't started testing everything though to see if any of it works. :)

2011-Jul-13 15:38:42 by psilord:
It seems that I don't need the nscd glibc patch as all of the checkpoints happened properly and were never deferred.

I fixed up the version mismatch hold reason in the job ad since it bit me that it was so vague.

At this time, the x86_64 RHEL 6.1 full port is code complete and passes all of the stduniv tests.

2011-Jul-14 13:52:13 by psilord:
I checked it into the V7_6-branch, merged it to V7_7_0-branch, and then to master.

It broke in the nmi bulid, but for reasons that did not originate with me. Hopefully, those will be resolved soon. When the build goes green, I'll resolve this ticket.

2011-Jul-27 11:49:56 by psilord:
The port is done, the tests pass, this ticket is finished.
